Battle Royals is a variation on card dueling games, such as Yu-Gi-Oh! and Pokemon. Utilizing basic card decks and dice common to Dungeons and Dragons or other dice games.
The overall idea is to have a duel style game that is easy to set up and learn. With only eighteen rules, introduction is a quick process and players may be able to be proficient in two or three Sessions.
Structure
Set up requires separating cards into their respective suits with face cards in their own stack. Primary stats consist of Hearts(♥)as Hit points, Spades(♠) as Defense points and Diamonds(♦)as Attack points. Clubs(♣)are used to determine which player may take their turn by way of highest card, turns are NOT sequential and players may not have a turn for multiple draws. Three face cards are drawn by each player from their respective deck and then one of each "stat"(♦♥♠) cards is drawn for each unit, each unit must have one of each stat to be considered ready for battle. Players then draw the top card from the "chance"(♣) or clubs deck, the player with the high card decides their attacking unit and the target enemy unit. The attacking unit must defeat the defending units defense(♠) rating, the difference is the applied to hit points as damage. A unit is defeated when hit point reach zero, once defeated the unit is placed in the graveyard🦴. The game ends when one player stands the victor, or annihilation by world monster.
Units
Units have a bonus to their stats based upon suit and rank. All units have special abilities which will be covered further on.
The Kings.♦♥♣♠+3
King units have a plus three to the suit which they belong, exception in the king of clubs who has a bonus to attack points. On player turn the king may draw another stat card of the suit it belongs to.
The Queens.♦♥♣♠+2
Queen units have a plus two to the suit they belong, exception in the queen of clubs which has a bonus to defense points. On player turn the queen may summon a dead king from the graveyard allowing drawing three more stat cards for the queen. The king is undead and provides no bonus itself.
The Jacks.♦♥♣♠+1
Jack units have a plus one to the suit they belong, exception in the jack of clubs which has a bonus to hit points. On player turn the jack may parry on the roll of Twenty side dice if it is attacked, eleven or more is a parry.
The Joker.
Joker units are world monsters, players may opt to not have joker in play, the world monster fights all players in order of lowest health to highest. When drawn the monster is placed in the center of all players and steals the top card of each stat deck from all players, thus the monster strength grows with the number of players. If the monster is not strong enough to defeat a units defense, fifty percent is reflected back to the monster.
Rules
History
The Rules have Changed overtime, the first version had the potential to end in stalemate due to a lack of inequality. As a fix the unit abilities and the world monster were added, Mega King has existed since the first match. The second version refines the abilities and clarifies aspects of the rules not previously covered. These versions are included for documentation and only the most current version will be used officially.
Version 1
1.When a unit dies it is placed face up in the graveyard, stats are returned to their respective deck and stat deck are shuffled
2.The D20 is rolled for every Attack 1-10 is a miss and 11-20 is a hit (opt)
3.The health becomes locked after a unit takes damage
4.The heart face cards have their own health pool, Health Stat can be modified so long as the unit still has positive hit points when health stat is removed
5.If a player has all three sevens drawn and applied to the same unit, Triple Seven applies, which is triple attack points
6.The deck of club is used to take each turn, to be reshuffled when the deck is empty, Decks must always be equivalent
7.Modifying is possible at any time
8.Stats may be flipped once per game all nine stat cards must be returned their decks and all deck are reshuffled
9.if all three kings are in play and they posses the nine of higher of their respective stat then Mega King may be formed. Mega King combine the stats of all three kings into one game ending monster
10.The Jokers will be shuffled in the units stat decks when drawn the D10 is rolled to determine power and and can be used for any stat
11.If two of the same chance cards are drawn the chance deck is shuffled
12.Jack Special negate attack on chance roll
13.Queen can special summon one king from the graveyard.(1)
14.Kings special draw one stat card of respective stat uses 1 turn
15.Sullen joker is placed in unit card and when pulled gets the top stats card from all players, This monster always targets the each players weakest unit. The monster rolls D20 and then players roll the D20 if the number is higher than monster, it sustains the applied damage.(opt)
(1). The summoned is still dead and does not offer a bonus however his drawn stats Apply directly to the Queen
Version 2
1.Chance(♣) decks must always be equal.
2.If chance(♣) cards are the same reshuffle chance decks. (revised in 2.1)
3.Stat may be flipped once per game.
4.One units stats may be flipped on Player turn by rolling Eleven or higher on a D20.
5.Modifying stat can be done at any time.
6.The D20 maybe rolled on each attack, 0-10 miss, 11-20 hit.(opt)
7.The Health(🂾🂽🂻)face cards have their own hit points, as such switching their health(♥) stat may be done after taking light damage.
8.Health(♥) is locked after taking damage.
9.When a unit dies it is placed face up in the Boneyard🦴.
10.The Raised King 🂮🂾🃎🃞 does not have a bonus only his drawn stats apply to the queen.
11.If a player has all three seven(🂧🂷🃇) cards on one unit, triple attack(♦)points.
12.If a player has all three kings and the Nine(🂩🂹🃉)of relevant stats in play then Mega King may be formed, The Mega King is comprised of all three Kings as one unit, each Kings ability is still available, all stats are applied as one unit.(revised in 2.1)
13.If player has 🃞 and 🃎 and either of the other Kings, Mega king may be formed by having two relevant stat cards. (revised in 2.1)
14.The Blank or Sullen Joker 🃟 is placed in the unit deck and when drawn steals the top card or each player stat decks. The monster attacks which ever unit has the lowest HP. The D20 is rolled for the monster and for the player if the player scores higher than the monster the damage is applied to the monster.(opt)(revised in 2.1)
15.If the Sullen Joker🃟 is drawn at the beginning all players draw stats before the monster.
16.When a unit has the three(🂣🂳🃃) of each stat it is protected by the Holy Trinity and is invincible.
17.If the Jacks 🂫🂻🃋🃛 parry roll is above fourteen then the damage is reflected onto the attacker.(revised in 2.1)
18.When a unit dies it is placed face up in the graveyard, stats are returned to their respective deck and stat deck are shuffled.
Version 2.1
Only Changes will be listed here.
2.If chance(♣) cards are the same  roll a D10
12.If a player has three kings and the Nine(🂩🂹🃉) or Ten(🂪🂺🃊) of relevant stat then Mega King may be formed,The Mega King is comprised of all three Kings as one unit, each Kings ability is still available, all stats are applied as one unit
13.If a player has 🃞🃎, both kings have the same stat bonus, therefore only two suits are necessary to form Mega King
14.A Single Sullen Joker🃟 is placed in the unit deck and when drawn steals the top card or each player stat decks. The monster attacks which ever unit has the lowest HP. The D20 is rolled for the monster and for the player if the player scores higher than the monster 50% of the damage is applied to the monster.(opt)
17.If the Jacks 🂫🂻🃋🃛 parry roll is above fourteen then 50% of the damage is reflected onto the attacker.
